greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array read by antidiagonals: A(n,k) is the number of nonnegative integer matrices with k columns and any number of nonzero rows with column sums n and columns in nonincreasing lexicographic order.
comment: The condition that the columns be in nonincreasing order is equivalent to considering nonequivalent matrices up to permutation of columns.
A(n,k) is the number of n-uniform k-block multisets of multisets.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1325
formula: A(n, k) = Sum_{j=0..k} abs(Stirling1(k, j))*A316674(n, j)/k!.
A(n, k) = Sum_{j=0..k} binomial(k-1, k-j)*A331278(n, j).
program: (PARI) T(n, k)={my(m=n*k); sum(j=0, m, binomial(binomial(j+n-1, n)+k-1, k)*sum(i=j, m, (-1)^(i-j)*binomial(i, j)))}
xref: The version with binary entries is A330942.
The version with distinct columns is A331278.
Other variations considering distinct rows and columns and equivalence under different combinations of permutations of rows and columns are:
Up to row permutation: A219727, A219585, A331161, A331160.
Up to column permutation: this sequence, A331572, A331278, A331570.
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Jan 13 2020
